data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Any of various tropical African shrubs or trees of the genus Coffea, especially C. arabica or C. canephora, widely cultivated in the tropics for their seeds that are dried, roasted, and ground to prepare a stimulating aromatic drink.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The beanlike seeds of this plant, two of which are found in each fruit.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The beverage prepared from the seeds of this plant.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: likes to drink coffee with breakfast.

data.text: A serving of such a beverage.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A moderate brown to dark brown or dark grayish brown.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An informal social gathering at which coffee and other refreshments are served.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The berry of trees belonging to the genus Coffea, natural order Rubiaceæ.
A drink made from the seeds of the coffee-tree, by infusion or decoction.
A light meal resembling afternoon tea, at which coffee is served.
